column5: I got it  a week or so ago and finally got some pictures.  First the old one. She was a good rig.

Last weekens I took the kids out for a first trip.    Needed downrigger mounting spots. I grabbed a bit of stainless steel from work and had the guys cut and bend it for me. Then took it home and marked, drilled, and polished it with an orbital sander. They came out pretty nice. I think I should scrape the green paint off the mounts from the previous boat.    I didn't want to add any holes and they fit right where the cleats were so I just matched the holes. I went with 1/8  thick rather than 1/4 so I could even use the same bolts.
Sweet!!! What an awesome rig.  A nice improvement from your last one.  You will definately enjoy that Sylvan.  A great boat.  Congrats.  Joley
Nice boat, congrats. I also like your downrigger mounting plate set up. Currently looking at mounting my two into my boat and your setup has given me an idea or two. Thanks.
Thanks guys...and glad to help John. I tried posting these pics a few minutes ago and they wouldn't...Trying again now.    St Marys River    The shoreline Is Michigan
Nice looking boat Dara you will get a lot of years out of it congrats  Rob
Your gonna like that new boat, congrats...
Sweet ride, a buddy of mine got the same boat last fall and has been quite happy. I'll have to keep an eye out for you on the river.  Get out there and get some slime on it now.
